items.text:
#### Singlestat Grids

Singlestat grids render one Singlestat for each series in the query, in a configurable number of columns, just like Singlegraph grids.
If a style is set on the grid, it will be applied to each generated cell individually.

#### Singlegraph Grids

A style may now be set on singlegraph grids as well, which will be applied to each generated cell individually. To apply a style around the entire grid, set the style on the enclosing cell.

It's been a minute since the last release, so there was a lot of
dependency updating to do, for security patches, feature updates,
and generally avoiding bit-rot.

Some highlights:

* Flot, the Javascript charting library used by Tessera, is
  finally [under active development
  again](http://www.flotcharts.org/blog/2018/02/04/flot-216-new-maintainers/)!
  There have been some all around cleanups and improvements, and
  it's distributed on [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/flot)
  now.
* [flot-d3-stack](https://www.npmjs.com/package/flot-d3-stack),
  the Flot plugin that provides streamgraph stacking, has been
  updated as well, both for the new Flot releaase and for the
  latest modularized D3 code, so the entirety of D3 is no longer
  needed.
* Nearly all the runtime dependencies have been updated, where available
* Updates to TypeScript, Grunt, Babel, and the rest of the build tools

* Hover-over tooltips are now aligned to the top of charts
* Singlegraph grids (and the new Singlestat grids) can now omit cells if the data series sums to zero. They've always had the `hide_zero_series` property, just never paid attention to it before
* Singlegraphs can now specify a units field, just like Singlestats
* Both Singlegraphs and Singlestats can hide the transform field (which identifies the transform applied to the summation) if desired
* Use system fonts where available (e.g. the San Francisco font on OS X, etc...)
* Added a script to generate screenshots of test dashboards using
  [Puppeteer](https://pptr.dev/), so visual changes and
  regressions can be tracked from release to release.
* There's a new set of [render test](/dashboards/tagged/render-test)
  dashboards to aid in that goal. 
* See the [full list of closed issues](https://github.com/tessera-metrics/tessera/milestone/11?closed=)
